channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Norway says Trump cited Nobel loss when discussing Greenland
item.description: The prime minister of Norway says President Trump cited the Nobel Prize as a reason for not pursuing a peaceful resolution on Greenland.
item.content:encoded: The prime minister of Norway says President Trump cited the Nobel Prize as a reason for not pursuing a peaceful resolution on Greenland.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Train crash kills more than three dozen in Spain
item.description: More than three dozen people were killed as two high-speed trains collided in southern Spain.
item.content:encoded: More than three dozen people were killed as two high-speed trains collided in southern Spain.
item.dc:creator: Miguel Macias

item.title: Italian fashion designer Valentino dies at 93
item.description: Garavani built one of the most recognizable luxury brands in the world. His clients included royalty, Hollywood stars, and first ladies.
item.content:encoded:
Garavani built one of the most recognizable luxury brands in the world. His clients included royalty, Hollywood stars, and first ladies.

(Image credit: Vittorio Zunino Celotto)
item.dc:creator: Maison Tran

item.title: Trump says he's pursuing Greenland after perceived Nobel Peace Prize snub
item.description: "Considering your Country decided not to give me the Nobel Peace Prize… I no longer feel an obligation to think purely of Peace," Trump wrote in a message to the Norwegian Prime Minister.
item.content:encoded:
"Considering your Country decided not to give me the Nobel Peace Prize… I no longer feel an obligation to think purely of Peace," Trump wrote in a message to the Norwegian Prime Minister.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Robbie Griffiths

item.title: At least 39 dead in Spain train collision
item.description: At least 39 people were killed in a high-speed train collision in southern Spain Sunday, police said. Efforts to recover the bodies are continuing, and the death toll is likely to rise.
item.content:encoded: At least 39 people were killed in a high-speed train collision in southern Spain Sunday, police said. Efforts to recover the bodies are continuing, and the death toll is likely to rise.
item.dc:creator: Miguel Macias

item.title: Trump attends World Economic Forum amid U.S.-European tensions over Greenland
item.description: President Trump is attending the World Economic Forum meeting in Davos this year with fellow world leaders who seek answers on Ukraine and Gaza.
item.content:encoded: President Trump is attending the World Economic Forum meeting in Davos this year with fellow world leaders who seek answers on Ukraine and Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Trump escalates tensions across Europe with new threats about Greenland acquisition
item.description: President Trump said the U.S. will impose tariffs on eight European countries until the U.S. acquires Greenland. The announcement came as a congressional delegation visited Denmark to ease tensions.
item.content:encoded: President Trump said the U.S. will impose tariffs on eight European countries until the U.S. acquires Greenland. The announcement came as a congressional delegation visited Denmark to ease tensions.
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: Former diplomat on Trump's tariff threats against NATO allies over Greenland issue
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks Kurt Volker, a former U.S. ambassador to NATO, about what critics perceive as the Trump administration's threat to the transatlantic alliance.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks Kurt Volker, a former U.S. ambassador to NATO, about what critics perceive as the Trump administration's threat to the transatlantic alliance.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: China's economy is rising, but many citizens are left behind, analysts say
item.description: China's National Bureau of Statistics released data on its 2025 GDP growth Monday. Analysts say it reveals strong economic growth for the country, but ordinary people still face deep challenges.
item.content:encoded: China's National Bureau of Statistics released data on its 2025 GDP growth Monday. Analysts say it reveals strong economic growth for the country, but ordinary people still face deep challenges.
item.dc:creator: Ashish Valentine

item.title: Trump's Board of Peace requires nations pay $1 billion for permanent membership
item.description: President Trump's Board of Peace is part of his next steps for Gaza. Its charter includes broad international powers for Trump and a $1 billion contribution from nations seeking permanent membership.
item.content:encoded: President Trump's Board of Peace is part of his next steps for Gaza. Its charter includes broad international powers for Trump and a $1 billion contribution from nations seeking permanent membership.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin
